articles.headline: Vote of Confidence Is Only the First Step for Greece
articles.snippet: If the government wins a vote of confidence, it will also win an immediate infusion of cash that will tide it over.
articles.abstract: If the government wins a vote of confidence, it will also win an immediate infusion of cash that will tide it over.
articles.lead_paragraph: If the Greek government can win a crucial vote of confidence Tuesday night, paving the way to passing austerity measures into law this month, it will also win an immediate infusion of cash that will tide it — and the rest of Europe — over for now.

articles.headline: Health Law in a Swirl of Forecasts
articles.snippet: A survey by McKinsey & Company about health coverage under the new law has come under fire, while other polls show conflicting predictions.
articles.abstract: A survey by McKinsey & Company about health coverage under the new law has come under fire, while other polls show conflicting predictions.
articles.lead_paragraph: The debate over the effects of the federal health care law on employer-provided insurance has been intensifying in recent weeks, with controversial polls and consultants contradicting one another about whether employees will benefit or lose coverage by 2014.

articles.headline: Wal-Mart Case Is a Blow for Big Cases and Their Lawyers
articles.snippet: The Supreme Court ruling set higher barriers for bringing several types of nationwide class actions against a large company with many branches.
articles.abstract: The Supreme Court ruling set higher barriers for bringing several types of nationwide class actions against a large company with many branches.
articles.lead_paragraph: With the dismissal of a sex-discrimination lawsuit brought on behalf of 1.5 million women who have worked at Wal-Mart, the Supreme Court on Monday significantly tightened the rules for how a large group of individuals can join together to sue a company for alleged harm done to them.

articles.headline: Support Is Mutual for Senator and Utah Industry
articles.snippet: Senator Orrin G. Hatch has helped the nutritional supplement industry, and been rewarded with donations.
articles.abstract: Senator Orrin G. Hatch has helped the nutritional supplement industry, and been rewarded with donations.
articles.lead_paragraph: SALT LAKE CITY — A drive along mountain-lined Interstate 15 here shows why Senator Orrin G. Hatch is considered a hero in this region nicknamed the Silicon Valley of the nutritional supplement industry.

articles.headline: Despite Setback, Plaintiffs to Pursue Wal-Mart Cases
articles.snippet: After being dealt a setback by the Supreme Court, the plaintiffs’ lawyers in a sex-discrimination class action against Wal-Mart said they might pursue different strategies.
articles.abstract: After being dealt a setback by the Supreme Court, the plaintiffs’ lawyers in a sex-discrimination class action against Wal-Mart said they might pursue different strategies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart has spent 10 years fighting claims that it discriminated against female employees, and by many accounts, it has improved its hiring and promotion policies for women during those years.

articles.headline: Upending Anonymity, These Days the Web Unmasks Everyone
articles.snippet: Pervasive social media services, cheap cellphone cameras, free photo and video Web hosts have made privacy all but a thing of the past.
articles.abstract: Pervasive social media services, cheap cellphone cameras, free photo and video Web hosts have made privacy all but a thing of the past.
articles.lead_paragraph: Not too long ago, theorists fretted that the Internet was a place where anonymity thrived.

articles.headline: As Secession Nears, Sudan Steps Up Drive to Stop Rebels
articles.snippet: Demanding political reform and autonomy, tens of thousands of rebel fighters in the Nuba Mountains have refused the Sudanese government’s threat to disarm.
articles.abstract: Demanding political reform and autonomy, tens of thousands of rebel fighters in the Nuba Mountains have refused the Sudanese government’s threat to disarm.
articles.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — The Sudanese Army and its allied militias have gone on an unsparing rampage to crush rebel fighters in the Nuba Mountains of central Sudan, bombing thatch-roofed villages, executing elders, burning churches and pitching another region of the country into crisis, according to United Nations officials and villagers who have escaped.

articles.headline: U.S. Releases Graphic Images to Deter Smokers
articles.snippet: Nine images — one of a corpse and another of a man with a tracheotomy opening in his neck — are to appear on cigarette packages next year.
articles.abstract: Nine images — one of a corpse and another of a man with a tracheotomy opening in his neck — are to appear on cigarette packages next year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal health officials released on Tuesday their final selection of nine graphic warning labels to cover the top half of cigarette packages beginning next year, over the opposition of tobacco manufacturers.
